samples.context: Tissue is defined as a group of cells that are similar in structure and/or work together to achieve a particular function. The three main types of simple tissues in plants are: (i) Parenchyma (ii) Collenchyma (iii) Sclerenchyma.
samples.question: What are the main types of simple tissues?

samples.context: Complex tissues in plants are made up of more than one type of cells, while simple tissues consist of only one type.
samples.question: How do complex tissues differ from simple tissues?

samples.context: The three main types of simple tissues in plants include Parenchyma, Collenchyma, and Sclerenchyma.
samples.question: List the three types of simple plant tissues.

samples.context: Tissue is defined as a group of cells that are similar in structure and/or work together to achieve a particular function.
samples.question: What is the definition of tissue?

samples.context: Parenchyma, Collenchyma, and Sclerenchyma are the main types of simple tissues in plants.
samples.question: Name one type of simple tissue in plants.
